abstract.p: Psion PLC, Europe's largest manufacturer of palmtop computers, to buy Teklogix International, Canadian company that makes wireless communications equipment (S)

block.p: Europe's largest manufacturer of palmtop computers, Psion P.L.C. of Britain, has agreed to buy Teklogix International Inc., a Canadian company that makes wireless communications equipment, for cash and stock valued at 544 million Canadian dollars, or about $370 million. Psion will pay the equivalent of 35 Canadian dollars for each Teklogix share, a 41 percent premium to the closing price on Tuesday. The founding shareholders of Teklogix, based in Mississauga, Ontario, will tender their 27 percent holding to Psion.
